subject: Re: [junit] Can I control JUnit's output??
msgSnippet: ... I recommend you look at JUnit-addons test runner (search the web), which allows you to build your own test listener and easily connect it to the test
messageBody:
dcarissi wrote:

> We run JUnit in batch mode by calling
> junit.textui.TestRunner()
>
> As the test runs, I get the periods across the screen for each
> testcase that has run. When it's done, I see the summary of elapsed
> time and number of testcases run along with any error stack traces.
> Is there any way that I can change this output?? For example, it
> would be nice to display the information like the name of the class,
> name of the test method being run, and followed by either a
> successful message or a failure message with the associated stack
> trace. Is this possible and if so, what's the magic code sequence???

I recommend you look at JUnit-addons test runner (search the web), which
allows you to build your own test listener and easily connect it to the
test execution engine. With that, you might be able to print out
everything you need.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
